contextId.information: This is a reference to the Holy Spirit. AT: "the Holy Spirit, whom the Father promised to send" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the promise of the Father

contextId.information: "God would set one of David's descendants upon David's throne." AT: "God would appoint one of David's descendants to be king in David's place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he would set one of the fruit of his body upon his throne

contextId.information: Here the word "them" refers to the profit that they made from selling their property and possessions. AT: "distributed the proceeds to all" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: distributed them to all

contextId.information: These words refer to money. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Silver and gold

contextId.information: Here the word "name" refers to power and authority. AT: "With the authority of Jesus Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: In the name of Jesus Christ

contextId.information: Here the word "name" refers to Jesus. Possible meanings are 1) "because this man believes in Jesus" or 2) "because John and I believe in Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: by faith in his name

contextId.information: Here the word "mouth" refers to the words that the prophets spoke and wrote down. AT: "the words of all the prophets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the mouth of all the prophets

contextId.information: Here the words "presence of the Lord" is a metonym for the Lord himself. AT: "from the Lord" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: from the presence of the Lord

contextId.information: Here the word "mouth" refers to the words that the prophets spoke and wrote down. AT: "the words of his holy prophets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the mouth of his holy prophets

contextId.information: Here the word "name" refers to authority. AT: "by whose authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in what name

contextId.information: Here the word "name" refers to power and authority. AT: "by the power of Jesus Christ of Nazareth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth

contextId.information: The phrase "name ...  given among men" refers to the person of Jesus. AT: "no other person under heaven, who is given among men, by whom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: no other name ... given among men

contextId.information: Here the word "mouth" refers to the words that David spoke or wrote down. AT: "by the words of your servant, our father David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: through the mouth of your servant, our father David

contextId.information: Here the word "hand" is used to mean God's power. Additionally, the phrase "your hand and your desire decided" shows God's power and plan. AT: "to do all that you had decided because you are powerful and did all that you planned" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: to do all that your hand and your plan had decided

contextId.information: Here the word "name" refers to power and authority. AT: "through the power of your holy servant Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: through the name of your holy servant Jesus

contextId.information: Here the word "heart" refers to the thoughts and the word "soul" refers to the emotions. Together they refer to the total person. AT: "thought the same way and wanted the same things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: were of one heart and soul

contextId.information: Here the word "name" refers to the person of Jesus. AT: "not to speak anymore about this person, Jesus." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:act:04:15|4:17]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in this name

contextId.information: Here the word "blood" refers to Jesus' death. This is an idiomatic way of saying that they are responsible for killing him. AT: "desire to make us responsible for this man's death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: desire to bring this man's blood upon us

contextId.information: Here Peter uses the word "tree" to refer to the cross which was made out of wood. AT: "by hanging him on a cross" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: by hanging him on a tree

contextId.information: "nation" refers to the people in it. AT: "I will judge the people of the nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I will judge the nation

contextId.information: This refers to the people of Egypt. AT: "over all the people of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: over Egypt

contextId.information: "Egypt" refers to the people of Egypt. AT: "the people of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: over Egypt

contextId.information: "was rescuing them through Moses" or "was using Moses to rescue them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: by his hand was rescuing them

contextId.information: "by means of the angel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: by the hand of the angel

contextId.information: This refers to the people who lived in the land before Israel. AT: "the people who previously lived here" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the nations

contextId.information: The Jews regarded uncircumcised people as disobedient to God. Stephen uses "hearts and ears" to represent to the Jewish leaders who acted the way Gentiles act when they do not obey or listen to God. AT: "you refuse to obey and hear" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: uncircumcised in heart and ears

contextId.information: The title "Christ" refers to Jesus, the Messiah. AT: "told them that Jesus is the Messiah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: proclaimed to them the Christ

contextId.information: This is the Old Testament book Isaiah. AT: "reading from the book of the prophet Isaiah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: reading the prophet Isaiah

contextId.information: Philip understood that this meant he was to stay close to the person riding in the chariot. AT: "accompany the man in this chariot" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: stay close to this chariot

contextId.information: "chosen instrument" refers to something that is set apart for service. AT: "I have chosen him to serve me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he is a chosen instrument of mine

contextId.information: This is an expression meaning "for telling people about me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: for the cause of my name

contextId.information: Here "name" is a metonym for the gospel message of Jesus Christ. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in the name of the Lord Jesus

contextId.information: This expression refers to the fact that the Gentiles believed the gospel message about Jesus. AT: "believed the message of God about Jesus" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: had received the word of God

contextId.information: This is a reference to some of the Jews who believed that every believer must be circumcised. AT: "some Jewish believers in Jerusalem who wanted all followers of Christ to be circumcized" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: they who belonged to the circumcision group

contextId.information: Apparently the animals in the sheet were animals which the Jewish law in the Old Testament forbade the Jews to eat. This can be said in a positive way. AT: "I have eaten only meat from holy and clean animals" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: nothing unholy or unclean has ever entered into my mouth

contextId.information: This refers to the animals in the sheet. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: What God has declared clean, do not call unclean

contextId.information: Here "ears" refers to the believers' hearing about the event. AT: "the believers in the church" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: ears of the church

contextId.information: Here "added" means they came to believe the same thing as the others. AT: "many more people also believed in the Lord" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: many people were added to the Lord

contextId.information: Here "the hand of Herod" refers to "Herod's hold" or "Herod's plans." AT: "rescued me from the harm Herod had planned for me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: delivered me out of the hand of Herod

contextId.information: Paul is saying the man is acting like the devil. AT: "You are like the devil" or "You act like the devil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: You son of the devil

contextId.information: Here "hand' represents the power of God and "upon you" implies punishment. AT: "The Lord will punish you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the hand of the Lord is upon you

contextId.information: This refers to God's mighty power. AT: "with great power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: with an uplifted arm

contextId.information: This refers to the people of Israel. AT: "gave to the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: brought to Israel

contextId.information: Here the word "sayings" represents the message of the prophets. AT: "the writings of the prophets" or "the message of the prophets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: sayings of the prophets

contextId.information: The phrase "experienced decay" is a metonym for "his body decayed." AT: "his body rotted" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: experienced decay

contextId.information: The phrase "experienced no decay" is a way to say "his body did not decay." AT: "did not rot" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: experienced no decay

contextId.information: Here "words" refers to the message that Paul had spoken. AT: "this same message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: these same words

contextId.information: The "city" represents the people in the city. This phrase is used to show the great response to the Lord's word. AT: "a large part of the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: almost the whole city

contextId.information: Here "word" refers to the message about Jesus that they had believed. AT: "praised God for the message about the Lord Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: praised the word of the Lord

contextId.information: Here "word" refers to the message about Jesus. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Those who believed spread the word of the Lord through the whole region" or "Those who believed went everywhere in the region and told others about the message of Jesus"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The word of the Lord was spread out through the whole region

contextId.information: Here "city"refers to the people in the city. AT: "most of the people of the city were divided" or "most of the people of the city did not agree with each other" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the majority of the city was divided

contextId.information: Here "you hearts" refers to the people. AT: "giving you enough to eat and things about which to be happy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: filling your hearts with food and gladness

contextId.information: Here "heart" refers to the "minds" or "inner beings." AT: "who knows the people's minds" or "who knows what people think" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: who knows the heart

contextId.information: "for God's name." Here "name" refers to God. AT: "for himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: for his name

contextId.information: Here "words" stands for a message. AT: "What the prophets said agrees" or "The prophets agree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The words of the prophets agree

contextId.information: Here "he" refers to Moses, which is to mean that "the law is read." AT: "reading the law of Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he is read

contextId.information: Here "name" refers to the whole person. AT: "because they believe in our Lord Jesus Christ" or "because they serve our Lord Jesus Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ

contextId.information: Here "word" stands for a message. AT: "the message about the Lord" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the word of the Lord

contextId.information: Here "word" stands for the message. AT: "the message about the Lord" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the word of the Lord

contextId.information: Here this stands for the believers in the churches. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the churches

contextId.information: Here "word" stands for "message." AT: "the message about Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the word

contextId.information: Here "name" stands for speaking with the authority or as the representative of Jesus Christ. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in the name of Jesus Christ

contextId.information: Here "house" stands for the people who live in the house. AT: "all the members of your household" or "your family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: your house

contextId.information: Here "word" stands for a message. AT: "They told him the message about the Lord Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: They spoke the word of the Lord to him

contextId.information: Here "word" stands for "message" or "command." AT: "sent a message to the guards" or "sent a command to the guards" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: sent word to the guards

contextId.information: Here "the city" stands for the people in the city. AT: "caused the people of the city to be in an uproar" or "caused the people of the city to riot" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: set the city in an uproar

contextId.information: The "Areopagus" was the place where  the leaders met. AT: "to the leaders that met on the Areopagus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: to the Areopagus

contextId.information: Here "blood" stands for the guilt of their actions. Here "heads" refers to the whole person. Paul tells the Jews they are solely responsible for the judgment they will face for their stubbornness if they refuse to repent. AT: "You alone bear the responsibility for your punishment for sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: May your blood be upon your own heads

contextId.information: Here "house" refers to the people who lived together. AT: "the people who lived with him in his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: all those who lived in his house

contextId.information: The Jews took Paul by force to bring Paul before the court. Here "judgment seat" refers to the place where Gallio sat when he made legal decisions in court. AT: "took him so that the governor could judge him at the judgment seat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: brought him before the judgment seat

contextId.information: "Gallio dismissed them from the judgment seat." Here "judgment seat" refers to the place where Gallio sits to make legal decisions in court. AT: "Gallio made them leave his presence in the court" or "Gallio made them leave the court" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Gallio made them leave the judgment seat

contextId.information: Here "church" refers to the believers in Jerusalem. AT: "greeted the members of the church of Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: greeted the Jerusalem church

contextId.information: Here "word" stands for a message. AT: "the message about the Lord" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the word of the Lord

contextId.information: Here "name" refers to Jesus' power and authority. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the name of the Lord Jesus

contextId.information: This stands for the power and authority of Jesus. AT: "by the authority of Jesus" or "by the power of Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: By the Jesus

contextId.information: This was an exaggeration to show how popular the goddess Diana was. Here the words "Asia" and "the world" refer to the people in Asia and the known world. AT: "whom many people in Asia and in other parts of the world worship" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole|Hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: whom all Asia and the world worships

contextId.information: Here "city" refers to the people. The city is spoken of as if it were a container. And, "confusion" is spoken of as if it were the contents that filled the container. AT: "Then people all over the city became upset and started shouting" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The whole city was filled with confusion

contextId.information: This speaks about something humble as if it were low to the ground. The word "mind" stands for a person's inner attitude. AT: "humility" or "humbleness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: lowliness of mind

contextId.information: Here "chains" refers to Paul's being arrested and put in prison. AT: "people put me in prison and cause me to suffer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: chains and sufferings await me

contextId.information: Here "kingdom" stands for God's rule as king. AT: "to whom I preached the message about God's reign as king" or "to whom I preached about how God will show himself as king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: among whom I went about proclaiming the kingdom

contextId.information: Here "blood" stands for a person's death, which, in this case, is not physical death but spiritual death when God declares a person guilty of sin. Paul had told them God's truth. AT: "I am not responsible for anyone whom God judges guilty of sin because they did not trust in Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I am innocent of the blood of any man

contextId.information: Here "blood" stands for Christ's death. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: his own blood

contextId.information: Here "tears" refers to Paul's crying because of the strong emotion of concern he felt while he was warning the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: with tears

contextId.information: Here "words" refers to what Jesus has said. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the words of the Lord Jesus

contextId.information: Here "a ship crossing over" stands for the crew that would sail the ship. AT: "When we found a ship with a crew sailing over to Phoenicia" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: When we found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia

contextId.information: Here "ship" stands for the crew that was sailing the ship. AT: "the crew would unload the cargo from the ship" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: where the ship was to unload its cargo

contextId.information: Here "name" refers to the person of Jesus. AT: "for the sake of the Lord Jesus" or "because I believe in the Lord Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: for the name of the Lord Jesus

contextId.information: Here "blood" stands for Stephen's life. To spill blood means to kill. This can be stated in active form. AT: "they killed Stephen who testified about you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the blood of Stephen your witness was spilled

contextId.information: Here "conscience" refers to a person's inner morality that chooses between right and wrong. AT: "to be blameless" or "to always do what is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: to have a conscience without blame

contextId.information: Here "judgment seat" refers to Festus' ruling as judge over Paul's trial. AT: "sat upon the seat where he acted as judge" or "he sat down as judge" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: sat in the judgment seat

contextId.information: The "judgment seat" refers to Caesar's authority to judge Paul. This can be stated in active form. AT: "I ask to go before Caesar, so he can judge me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I stand before the judgment seat of Caesar where I must be judged

contextId.information: Here "judgment seat" refers to Festus ruling over Paul's trial as judge. AT: "I sat upon the seat to act as judge" or "I sat down as judge" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I sat in the judgment seat

contextId.information: The word "name" here stands for Jesus himself. AT: "to stop people from believing in Jesus" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: against the name of Jesus

contextId.information: Here "voice" stands for the person speaking. AT: "I heard someone speaking to me who said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I heard a voice speaking to me that said

contextId.information: This refers to what the person in the vision told Paul. AT: "what the person from heaven told me in the vision" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the heavenly vision

contextId.information: Here "words" stands for Paul's message. AT: "I speak a message that is true and serious" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I speak words of truth and soberness

contextId.information: Here "prison chains" stands for being a prisoner. AT: "but, of course, I do no want you to be a prisoner like I am" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: but without these prison chains

contextId.information: The phrase "stand before Caesar" refers to Paul's going to court and letting Caesar judge him. AT: "You must stand before Caesar so he can judge you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: You must stand before Caesar

contextId.information: Here "Israel" stands for the people. AT: "what the people of Israel are" or "what the Jews are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what Israel is

contextId.information: Here "kingdom of God" stands for God's rule as king. AT: "told them about God's rule as king" or "told them how God would show himself as king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: testified about the kingdom of God

contextId.information: Here "word" stands for a message or statement. AT: "after Paul had said one more thing" or "after Paul had made this statement" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: after Paul had spoken this one word

contextId.information: Here "heart" stands for the mind. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: understand with their heart
